javadoc:
Performs a batch import using the data provided in the {@link BatchInfo} object which specifies what files and the import language that should be used.

If there are just a few files to import, they will be opened using the ProgramManager, otherwise the programManager parameter will be unused.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Start a Batch Import session with an already populated BatchInfo
 instance.

params.name: destFolder
params.comment: DomainFolder where to place imported files

params.name: programManager
params.comment: ProgramManager to use when opening newly imported files, null ok

params.name: stripLeading
params.comment:
boolean true if each import source's leading path should be omitted
 when creating the destination project folder path.

params.name: stripAllContainerPath
params.comment:
boolean true if each imported file's parent container
 source path should be completely omitted when creating the destination project folder path.
 (the imported file's path within its container is still used)

methods.name: fsrlToPath
methods.comment:
Convert a imported file's FSRL into a target project path, using the import options
 #stripAllContainerPath and #stripLeadingPath.
 
 Not private so it can be accessed by unit tests.

params.name: fsrl
params.comment: FSRL to convert to a path

params.name: userSrc
params.comment:
FSRL of the container file that is the parent of the FSRL being
 converted.

params.name: stripLeadingPath
params.comment:
boolean option that causes the path to the file the user
 picked to be truncated or left intact.

params.name: stripInteriorContainerPath
params.comment:
boolean option that causes the interior paths (ie.
 anything inside the user-added source directory or container file) to be stripped.

return.comment:
String path (with '/' separators) created according to the user's options
 #stripAllContainerPath and #stripLeadingPath.

name: ImportBatchTask
comment:
Performs a batch import using the data provided in the BatchInfo object which
 specifies what files and the import language that should be used.
 
 If there are just a few files to import, they will be opened using the ProgramManager,
 otherwise the programManager parameter will be unused.
